channel.title: So I've heard?
channel.description:
I've been hearing lately that C++ is just like Java, is it true?
Because i have the huge C++ book, and I'm willing to learn if it's true.

item.title: So I've heard?
item.dc:creator: @Ben Ben
item.description:
@Ben wrote:

I think any good programmer should know some C++, if not be an expert.
Go for it !

Read full topic

item.title: So I've heard?
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

C++ isn’t that hard, but I still prefer learning more of Java.

Read full topic

item.title: So I've heard?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

They are rather similar, much more similar than say lisp or prolog or something, and if you are comfortable with either C++ or Java the other one will come to you without many problems. There are certain quirks and caveats with each language that you will have to learn and work around or with, but other than that they are both nice procedural object oriented programming languages.

Read full topic

item.title: So I've heard?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

oh wow, would you look at that: http://www.cplusplus.com/doc/tutorial/typecasting/

super_ quizzing people on the internet is not the ideal way to prove knowledge

Read full topic

item.title: So I've heard?
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

[quote=“light232, post:6, topic:300459”][quote author=zstars link=topic=396731.msg2946644#msg2946644 date=1252253208]
Java’s core language is basically a subset of C++'s core language. Meaning that though they are similar, it’s easier to go from C++ to Java than the other way round. The Java standard library however, is actually larger than the C++ one. Nonetheless, they are rather different, so knowing one doesn’t help much when learning the other.
[/quote]
dunno, C++ was easier for me, java is my first language[/quote]

You probably don’t know C++. If you did, explain to me what reinterpret_cast() does. Then explain what static_cast() does. And then what template specialization is.

Read full topic

Java’s core language is basically a subset of C++'s core language. Meaning that though they are similar, it’s easier to go from C++ to Java than the other way round. item.title: So I've heard?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Noobie22, post:22, topic:300291”]if(R.I.P RSC == getsOffThis) { death(); } else { mitb(); }[/quote]

It would be much easier to learn c++ if you knew a decent amount of Java. THAT IS NOT PROGRAMMMING^^

Make stuff irrelevant to private servers and see where that goes.

Not to mention your little ‘code’ up there means RSC dies if he leaves you alone, and goes to mitb if he doesnt.
